str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To will, intend, desire, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to 'will, ' i.e. be willing.
To pass through, spread (as a report). From dia and erchomai; to traverse.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Achaia, a country of Europe.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To encourage, exhort, persuade. Middle voice from pro and the base of trope; to turn forward for oneself, i.e. Encourage.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
To receive, welcome, entertain (with hospitality), embrace. From apo and dechomai; to take fully, i.e. Welcome, approve.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and ginomai; to become near, i.e. Approach; by implication, to appear publicly.
Much, many; often.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From sun and ballo; to combine, i.e. to converse, consult, dispute, to consider, to aid, to join, attack.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
